channel.title: Food Glitch... Last thing i gotta fix before my release
channel.description:
In my server, all my max levels are 110, but for some reason i can never reach over 99. Example:
I can reach 99 hp if the food i eat takes me up to exactly 99. like if i have 77hp and eat a shark, which heals 20, it takes me to 99 but if i have 78hp and eat a shark, it keeps me at 78 and wastes my shark :[
does anyone have anything to say that can help me? this is the last glitch i have to fix before i release my server, and its very important to pking :\

item.title: Food Glitch... Last thing i gotta fix before my release
item.dc:creator: @Skullator Skullator
item.description:
@Skullator wrote:

Replace max lvl code with -

for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 110; lvl++) { points += Math.floor( (double) lvl + 150.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 110; }

Read full topic

item.title: Food Glitch... Last thing i gotta fix before my release
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

hey is your server online and portforwarded or is that what u mean by “release”?

and my max lev code is:

[code]public int getXPForLevel(int level) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		if (lvl >= level) {
			return output;
		}
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
	}
	return 0;
}

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
	int points = 0;
	int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 135; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 135;
}

public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill){
int Attack = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]);
int Defence = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);
int Strength = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]);
int Hitpoints = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
int Ranging = getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]);
int Prayer = getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]);
int Magic = getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]);
int Cooking = getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]);
int Woodcutting = getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]);
int Fletching = getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]);
int Fishing = getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]);
int Firemaking = getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]);
int Crafting = getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]);
int Smithing = getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]);
int Mining = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]);
int Herblore = getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]);
int Agility = getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]);
int Thieving = getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]);
int Slayer = getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]);
int Farming = getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]);
int Runecrafting = getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]);
if ((amount + playerXP[skill]) < 0 || playerXP[skill] > 2000000000) {
sendMessage(“Max XP value reached”);
return false;
}[/code]

and i think that is the Lvl code that matters =/

Also would you mind trying to get on my server? it requires hamachi though…

if u have network is HeroesDomain
and pass is 123

Read full topic

item.source: Food Glitch... Last thing i gotta fix before my release

item.title: Food Glitch... Last thing i gotta fix before my release
item.dc:creator: @Mosh_On Mosh_On
item.description:
@Mosh_On wrote:

hmm i tried changing it to return 110 but it didn’t seem to work.

[code] public int getXPForLevel(int level) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

    for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
        points += Math.floor(
                (double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
        if (lvl >= level) {
            return output;
        }
        output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
    }
    return 0;
}

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;
if (exp > 18000000)
return 110;
for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 110; lvl++) {
points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0
* Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
if (output >= exp) {
return lvl;
}
}
return 110;
}[/code]

Is my code correct? or did i forget to add a 110 in there somewhere?

Read full topic
item.source: Food Glitch... Last thing i gotta fix before my release

item.title: Food Glitch... Last thing i gotta fix before my release
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Oh ok well u no when u changed the max level you saw some code like this:

for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) { points += Math.floor( (double) lvl + 150.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 99; }

were you see Return 99;

you have to change the return 99; to return 110;

meaning the highest you can go is 110 (specified by the lvl <= +lvl+; code) and the lowest possible lvl you can go to (specified by the return +lvl+; code)

Read full topic

item.title: Food Glitch... Last thing i gotta fix before my release
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Hmm idk if this will work for you but i had the same problem and what i did is went into Client.java and searched for “case: +shark Item ID+” and when i got to it it said something then 99, wich is the highest itll go to so i changed that to 135 even though my max lvl was 99 but it fixed the problem to were i could eat food even if i was at 98hp…

I’d Make a backup Client.java incase you get some errors when you compile.

                        :D  Hope it helps  :D

Read full topic
